resources.string: You have recorded your positive test result anonymously in the app.\n\nThank you for helping to contain the spread of the coronavirus and for contributing to the health and well-being of those you share your life with and those around you.
Open the app to read the message
The app is not working because Bluetooth is turned off
The app is not working because Bluetooth is not permitted
Anonymous codes will be exchanged with nearby phones via low energy Bluetooth.
Anonymous codes will be exchanged with nearby phones via low energy Bluetooth.
Anonymous codes will be exchanged with nearby phones
Please enter the Covidcode that was given to you; please be careful to enter it accurately.
Change the settings to receive information directly in the event of a report.
Your phone was close to that of someone who tested positive
Anonymous codes will be exchanged with nearby phones
App currently unable to function properly
What to do if told that you’re positive
What to do if told that you’re positive
You will be given a Covidcode; please enter it to record your positive result anonymously in the app.
If you have possible coronavirus symptoms, contact your doctor or the medical emergency service.
Reactivate tracing to receive codes from phones of persons who may turn out to be positive.
Turn on Bluetooth on your device so that anonymous tracing works.
Enable the use of Bluetooth so that anonymous tracing works.
No potential exposure has been reported
Follow the public health recommendations on how to protect yourself and physical distancing.
You have tested positive for the new coronavirus.
What do I have to do?
Contact data is no longer being recorded
On this day, your phone was close to that of someone who tested positive.
You have tested positive for the new coronavirus.
You could be infectious without realising it!
Please protect your family, friends and those around you by following public health advice.
Call Helpline 111 to book a test, ideally 5 days after exposure.
Staying one step ahead of COVID-19
By using this app, you can help to contain the spread of COVID-19.
This app provides alerts on potential exposure to persons infected by the new coronavirus. If you act on the alert, you can help to stop the transmission of the virus.
Smartphones that are close to each other exchange data anonymously.
All data is encrypted and matching of data takes place locally on user devices; users cannot be identified or tracked by this app.
The app automatically recognises that two phones have been close to each other for a certain time.
It uses Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) to do this. The geographical location of your phone is not tracked.
Report of potential exposure to virus
The app notifies you if your phone was close to that of another app user who tests positive for the new coronavirus.
By contacting Helpline 111 and requesting a test, you can protect yourself and others.
In order to use the app, you must enable Bluetooth.
The app automatically recognises that two phones have been close to each other for a certain time.
It uses Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) to do this. The geographical location of your phone is not tracked.
No personal data is visible via Bluetooth.
The app operates using as little energy as possible. There is only a minor increase in battery usage.
In order to receive notifications from the app, you must enable messages.
In the event of a potential infection, you will receive a message on the lock screen.
Please follow the instructions or advice you are given by the health professionals caring for you and the public health response team, in order to keep yourself and those around you safe and healthy.
The app is ready to go
Thank you for helping to protect yourself and others.
It has not been possible to synchronise reports for some time. Please check that your device is connected to the internet.
If you have any questions, call us on Helpline 111
On this day, your phone was again close to that of someone who tested positive.
The time must be set correctly for tracing to work.
An unexpected error has occurred. Restart your device.
Change the settings to receive notification outside the app as well in the event of a report.
Install the new version of the app so that tracing works.
An unexpected error has occurred. Please retry.
Please enter the code in full, then press button.
Enable location information so that the app can use Bluetooth. The app does not recognise your location at any time.
Open the app to correct the error.
When phones that are running the app are close to each other for several minutes, they exchange anonymous codes.
The phones only exchange encrypted (secret) codes. These are saved on the phones and automatically deleted after 21 days.
Does Bluetooth have to be turned on all the time?
Yes. For phones to exchange codes, Bluetooth must be on all the time. This causes only a small increase in battery usage.

The app checks regularly whether any of the codes recorded by your phone came from the phone of someone who has tested positive for the virus. If it is possible that you were in contact, you will receive a message on your lock screen.

The app checks how long your phone was close to that of someone who tested positive, and estimates how close. You will receive a report only if it is suspected that you may have been significantly exposed to the virus.
If you have or develop any symptoms, contact your doctor.
It is important that you call Helpline 111 every time you receive a new report.

People who test positive for the new coronavirus are given a Covidcode. This ensures that only someone who tests positive can record a positive result in the app and anonymously inform their contacts.

Only encrypted (secret) codes are recorded and sent by the app. There are no personal data. Other phones with the same or similar apps check whether they were close to your phone in the past few days and notify their users, without ever identifying you.

The app never sends personal data. It only sends the dates when your phone was close for a certain time to other phones running the app. It could be that someone may remember that they met you that day.
You have symptoms but are unsure what you should do? Answer the questions to receive advice on what to do.
Now that a positive test result has been recorded, the app automatically stops tracing anonymous contacts.
When a positive result is recorded, the app automatically stops tracing.
Call Helpline 111 to get in touch with Public Health and request a test.
This button exits the app and opens the F.O.P.H. website.
COVID-19 Notifications must be activated to use the app.
COVID-19 Notifications must be activated to use the app.
Only anonymous IDs are exchanged, not data about your location or your person.
The app operates using as little energy as possible. There is only a minor increase in battery usage.
Do you really want to delete the notification?
Do you really want to delete the notification?
For your phone to recognise other phones at all times, the battery optimisation for this app must be disabled.
For the app to work, it must also run in the background. Battery optimisation can be disabled for individual apps, so that this is possible.
The app operates using as little energy as possible. There is only a minor increase in battery usage.
For tracing to work precisely, the app must also run in the background. This will cause a minor increase in battery usage.
Google Play Services is not up to date
Tracing is deactivated. Try to start it again.
Activate COVID-19 Notifications for anonymous tracing to work.
The message could not be sent. Please allow your random IDs to be shared with the COVID Alert Malta.
To activate tracing, an up-to-date version of Google Play Services is required.If no update is currently available on your device, please try again later.
An unexpected error has occurred while synchronising reports.
A secure connection cannot be made to the server. Please check or deactivate your VPN and/or your proxy or check whether you are connected via a public Wi-Fi network.
The app regularly checks the random IDs reported by users who have tested positive.
Please note down the following information
COVID Alert Malta remains active even if the app has been closed.
COVID Alert Malta breaks chains of infection.
Although no personal data relating to you is sent out, it may well be that someone remembers their encounter with you from the date.
Does anyone find out who I am?
If you develop any symptoms, do the coronavirus check or call your doctor.
Here you will find the Privacy Policy
Warning: This app does not protect you from COVID-19 infection.

The app is intended for proximity tracing and to warn users of potential exposure to someone infected by COVID-19. It is not a diagnostic tool either. Please read the instructions provided in each app screen carefully.
COVID-19 Public Health Response Team\nMinistry for Health\nMalta
Messages could not be checked because your mobile phone does not have enough free memory space. Please release memory space.
There have already been too many requests today. The app will try again later.
The COVID Alert Malta infoline will advise you on the option of taking a test free of charge
Enable tracing so the app can save encounters and receive reports
If tracing is disabled, you cannot receive any reports.
If tracing is disabled, you cannot receive any reports
This setting overwrites the app\'s visual status. Tracing functionality remains unaffected.
This button leaves the app and opens a website.
Change the settings to receive notification outside the app as well in the event of a report.
Open the system settings via the button below.
If not done already, you can now set COVID Alert Malta as the active region.
This device does not support Exposure Notifications.
Exposure Notifications are only supported for the main device user! Check that you are using your actual Google account.
Bluetooth Low Energy is not supported on this device.
Bluetooth Multiple Advertisement is not supported on this device.
Unauthorized package signature. Verify that you installed the app from the Google Play Store.
Unauthorized API usage. Please restart the app to try again.
Change your Cross-border Data Exchange preference
COVID Alert Malta can exchange exposure notifications with other COVID-19 contact tracing apps within the European Union and European Economic Area (EEA).

COVID Alert Malta can exchange exposure notifications with contact tracing apps of other EU and European Economic Area (EEA) countries of your choice. Enabling this feature means that you could be warned of potential exposure to COVID-19 should you have come in contact with an infected user of another European contact tracing app whilst in Malta or abroad.
COVID Alert Malta can now exchange data with other contact tracing and warning apps within the European Union.\n\nThis change is covered in our updated Data Privacy Policy.
Cross-border data exchange is currently unavailable

string.name: interop_mode_unavailable_bold
string.b: Cross-border data exchange is currently unavailable

resources.string: Select your preferred cross-border data exchange option.

string.name: interop_mode_instructions_bold
string.b: Select your preferred cross-border data exchange option.

resources.string: Do not exchange exposure notifications with other contact tracing apps of countries within the European Union and European Economic Area (EEA).
No exposure notifications are being exchanged with users of other European Union and EEA contact tracing apps.
No preferred option has been chosen for the exchange of exposure notifications with users of other European Union and EEA contact tracing apps.
You have not yet chosen your preferred option for the exchange of exposure notifications with users of other European Union and EEA contact tracing apps.
Exchange exposure notifications with contact tracing apps of your selected EU and European Economic Area (EEA) countries only.
Exposure notifications will be shared with users of contact tracing apps of EU and European Economic Area (EEA) countries that you have selected.
There has been an update to the countries available for the exchange of exposure notifications.
Exchange exposure notifications with users of all compatible contact tracing apps of countries in the European Union and European Economic Area (EEA).
Exposure notifications will be shared with users of all other compatible European Union and EEA contact tracing apps.
Synchronise only when connected to WiFi

COVID Alert Malta can exchange exposure notifications with contract tracing apps of other EU and European Economic Area (EEA) countries of your choice. Enabling this feature means that you could be warned of potential exposure to COVID-19 should you have come in contact with an infected user of another European contact tracing app whilst in Malta or abroad.
Cross-border data exchange is now available again. No further action required from your end.
